items.title: New Year Fireworks: January Natural Gas Rockets Into Expiration
items.summary: January Nymex natural gas futures headed into expiration on a tear, buoyed by a large storage withdrawal reported by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) in a rare Monday release and supportive demand forecasts heading into the New Year.

items.title: Pemex Natural Gas Output Edges Higher Amid E&P Leadership Shuffle
items.summary: Mexico’s state oil giant Petróleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, reported a modest year/year increase in natural gas production for November as the company tries to reduce its dependence on U.S. imports.

items.title: Weekly Lower 48 Natural Gas Withdrawals Must Increase to Match Historical Pace
items.summary: NGI is predicting the latest Lower 48 U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report for the week ended Dec. 26 shows a withdrawal of 37 Bcf.

items.title: New England, New York Grid Seen Reliable for Winter, With Natural Gas Supply Caveats
items.summary: Despite rising demand, the Northeast Power Coordinating Council (NPCC) said the region’s power grid has “sufficient” resources to maintain reliability during the 2025-2026 winter season.

items.title: U.S. LNG Buildout Accelerates Ahead of Schedule With Fourth Train Completed at Corpus Christi Expansion
items.summary: Cheniere Energy Inc. has completed the fourth train at the Corpus Christi LNG (CCL) Stage 3 expansion project in South Texas.

items.title: Following Steep Storage Pull, Natural Gas Futures Rally Through Midday
items.summary: Natural gas futures trended higher into afternoon trading after the latest federal inventory data showed underground stocks slipped into deficit territory relative to historical norms.

items.title: Frigid Temperatures, Henry Hub Surge Lift TTF to One-Month High
items.summary: European natural gas prices hit their highest point in a month on Monday as cold weather descended on parts of the continent.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Edge Higher as Third-Straight Oversized EIA Storage Draw Erases Surplus
items.summary: Natural gas futures added to gains after the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) on Monday reported a heavier-than-normal withdrawal of 166 Bcf from working storage for the week ended Dec. 19, wiping out what was left of a surplus to the fiv

items.title: Constitution Revived, Seeks FERC OK to Build Northeast Natural Gas Conduit
items.summary: Williams has requested federal regulators reissue a certificate for Constitution Pipeline Co. LLC, the long-dormant natural gas system designed to transport 600 MMcf/d to Northeast markets.

items.title: Natural Gas Reliability in Focus as FERC Examines PJM Power Gen Growth
items.summary: Federal regulators are taking on the myriad questions surrounding new domestic power generation — including natural gas-fired — to ensure grid reliability, as data centers and other large loads seek to co-locate with existing plants.

items.title: Chevron Unloads Venezuelan Crude at U.S. Ports as Enforcement Tightens
items.summary: Chevron has unloaded Venezuelan crude oil at U.S. ports under its existing Treasury licence, according to a Bloomberg report on Monday, even as U.S. enforcement actions disrupt other Venezuelan export routes and tighten pressure on unauthorised shipm

items.title: WTI Soars 2.5% With Yemen Tensions, Ukraine Stalling
items.summary: West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil prices were up 2.5% in Monday trading at 2:42 p.m. ET, reaching $58.17, as tensions flared in Yemen and hopes for a peace deal on the Russia-Ukraine front dissipated following unsuccessful talks between Kyiv an

items.title: Wind Power’s Lost Year May Be Setting Up a Reset in 2026
items.summary: 2025 has proven to be an annus horribilis for clean energy after Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA) rolled back major tax credits and imposed new restrictions, pressuring early-stage solar and wind energy pipelines. Indeed, a Cleanview analys

items.title: Kazakhstan Crude Production Dips 6% After Black Sea Drone Attack
items.summary: Following the Ukrainian drone attack that damaged a key export terminal on Russia’s Black Sea at end-November, Kazakhstan’s crude and condensate production has fallen by 6% so far in December compared to the average output in November, an anonymous i

items.title: U.S. Blockade Leaves $900 Million of Venezuelan Oil Stranded at Sea
items.summary: With a two-month "quarantine" placed on Venezuelan oil by the Trump administration in a foreign policy move called "gunboat diplomacy," new data estimate that roughly $900 million worth of crude is currently loaded on tankers, unable to depart Venezu
